0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Florastor(R), 250 to 500 mg (1 or 2 capsules) twice daily
  • Perenterol(R), 100 mg 3 times daily; may be increased to 200 mg 4 times daily
  • Antibiotic-associated diarrhea; Prophylaxis: 250 mg ORALLY 2 times daily initiated within 48 hours of antibiotic therapy and continued for 2 weeks after antibiotics were discontinued (study dose) or 1 g ORALLY daily administered within 72 hours of antibiotics and continued for 3 days after antibiotic discontinuation
  • Diarrhea, acute: 200 mg ORALLY 3 times daily for 2 days followed by 100 mg ORALLY 3 times daily for 5 days (study dose)
  • Diarrhea; Prophylaxis: 250 to 500 mg ORALLY daily (study dose)

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Florastor(R), 2 months or older, 250 to 500 mg (1 or 2 powder packets) twice daily
  • Perenterol(R), children and infants, 100 mg 3 times daily; may be increased to 200 mg 4 times daily
  • Antibiotic-associated diarrhea; Prophylaxis: 250 mg ORALLY 2 times daily within 24 hours of starting oral or IV antibiotics and continue for the duration of antibiotic therapy (study dose)
  • Diarrhea, acute: (2 months to 12 years): 250 to 750 mg ORALLY per day for 5 to 6 days (study dose)

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Antibiotic-associated diarrhea; Prophylaxis
  • Clostridium difficile diarrhea
  • Crohn's disease - Diarrhea, chronic
  • Diarrhea, acute
  • Diarrhea; Prophylaxis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• patients with central line (ie, central venous catheters, peripherally inserted central catheters, or ports) due to increased risk of fungemia transmission; discontinuation or central line removal may be required
  • hypersensitivity to yeasts, especially Saccharomyces boulardii

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Gastrointestinal:
  • lactose intolerance: contains 33 mg lactulose (similar to 1/3 slice of cheese); however, product has proven to increase lactase production
  • vegan diet; lactose in product sourced from milk for human consumption
  • factory is not kosher certified
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- concomitant use with antifungals not recommended
  • -- do not mix with beverages or foods that are carbonated, hot (ie, above 122 degrees F), or contain alcohol
